style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Moat Mountain Smokehouse and Brewing Company
breweries.description: Moat Mountain is a 174-seat brew pub, restaurant & inn located in one of North Conway’s historic buildings. Our award-winning ales and lagers are brewed on-site with fresh mountain water. Enjoy a pint with us or take some home in a growler or keg.

breweries.name: Wisconsin Brewing Company
breweries.description:
he Wisconsin Brewing Company brewhouse we're building is an exciting mixture of old world, artisan craftsmanship and state-of-the art brewing technology. Built in Hudson, WI, our German-engineered Huppmann Brewhouse will be capable of producing in excess of 100,000 barrels of Wisconsin craft beer annually. The tradition and history behind Huppmann goes back more than 130 years—perfect for true craft beer.

In addition to a great brew house, we have a one-barrel Pilot Brewery on site to develop many of our beers, as well as an event center for parties and other events. The event center also has a gift shop, where you can buy Wisconsin Brewing Company apparel, gift items, and of course, beer.

Put all these pieces together next to a scenic pond with access to bike trails and plenty of beautiful landscape and you can have one heck of a brewery experience.

data.name: Paultoberfest
data.description: It's that time of year! Brewed with venerable and legendary homebrewer Paul Johnson for Willamette Week's 2014 Pro Am, this Oktoberfest features Vienna, Munich, and Pilsner malts to give it a baked bread and toasty taste. Dive in - it's October!

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). breweries.name: 13 Virtues Brewing Co
breweries.description:
We are a three-barrel brew house born from the shadows of long tenured Portland restaurant, Philadelphia’s Steaks & Hoagies. The brewery addition was added back in 1994 but operated quietly as Oregon’s smallest micobrewery for many years. With the more recent additions of David Vohden and Cameron Moore, we have refocused our efforts on producing and sharing a constantly changing lineup of fresh quality beers from right here in the Great Pacific Northwest. Vohden oversees all brewery operations which he has met with great success. Most recently of which was a Silver Medal for our Woozy Weizenbock at the Great American Beer Festival. We see our recent efforts bringing exciting results.

We reached completion of a 3,500 sq ft. addition to expand our brew house in the Summer of 2013. Vohden and Moore finished installation of the glycol system just in time to quench the thirsty demands of the 2013 Oregon Brewers Festival with a crowd pleasing Traverse Cherry Wit Bier. In addition to the brew house expansion we have added four 7-barrel fermentation tanks for an eventual all around 7-barrel system upgrade. A Cellar was also added for barrel aging, sours, and other delectable experiments.

Although most of the square footage was utilized for brewing purposes. We were sure to save some space for all you beer drinkers. A mezzanine gives an elevated view down onto the open brewery floor. If you happen to drop by on a brew day you too can enjoy the sweet sensory overload and watch the action (or lack thereof). A beautiful black walnut bar, fully stocked with 13 drafts faucets was added to accompany the additional seating area and to cater to private events. However, the new bar and brewery seating are always open to patrons except in the case of private events. Another 60′ TV was added to the new mezzanine area and we continue to play all major sporting events. Go Blazers!

Some would say our legendary steak sandwiches and two dozen rotating taps are a match made in heaven. Please join us and stop by to see what’s new!

data.name: Prost
data.description: Traditional German decoction mashing produces a rich malt aroma with an initial complex malty sweetness that finishes dry with just a hint of German Noble hop aroma. This elegant beer is Nashville's example of the brew that traditionally kicks off German Oktoberfest and the historical European brewing season.

data.name: Punk-toberfest Oktoberfest Lager
data.description: A German style lager that is malty, with notes of caramel and bread and finishes clean with a hint of earthy, noble hops.

data.name: Red Flyer Marzen
data.description: Red Flyer Marzen, a year-round version of our Oktoberfest Lager, tap a pair of these “ruby slippers together and say “there’s no place like Herkimer”. Fully flavored, this red lager treads the thin line between malt and hop with grace.

data.name: Regenschauer Oktoberfest
data.description: (Sep. 1st - Oct. 31st) A Märzen style lager abound with sweet malt flavor and a complex hop aroma. "Regenschauer" is the German word for rainstorm that fits perfectly with autumn in New England as well as this beer made in the traditional Oktoberfest style. This hearty lager has a toasted malt flavor typical of the German malts used to make it. Its aroma is a mixture of hop citrus and a faint hint of the lager yeasts used to make it. SPECS: 14 SRM, OG 1.058, FG 1.015, 5.3% abv, 16.5 IBUs. Malts: Pils, Munic, Vienna, Cara-Pils. Hops: Saaz, Magnum, Tradition, Golding

breweries.name: Coastal Extreme Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Coastal Extreme Brewing Company was started in 1999 by four graduates of Colby College. During his college days the head brewer, Derek Luke, reaquired a homebrewing kit he had given his sister and quickly went to work brewing and passing his knowledge along to the company's president, Brent Ryan. As Graduation grew near and the cold reality of post-collegiate life set in Luke and Ryan knew that they could turn their affinity for beer and their new found ability to make it into a viable alternative to unemployment or sitting at a desk answering to "The Man". Of course, they couldn't do it by themselves, so after very little convincing, they got roommate and friends, Mark Sinclair and Will Rafferty to join them.

On Father's Day in 1999, after almost two years of planning and preperation, the first batch of Hurricane Amber Ale was brewed. By July 2nd the first kegs had been shipped to three Newport Restaurants and were quickly tapped and emptied. A little over a month after the release of the first kegs, 6-packs of Hurricane Amber Ale began to hit the shelves. Since then we have expanded our product line and our distribution territory but continue to brew up a storm in our Middletown Brewery.

data.name: Rochtoberfest
data.description: While many beer lovers dream of Deutschland, and the legendary Oktoberfest during this time of the year, there's no reason to fret. Rochesterites and Kinney Creek visitors alike won't have to travel far to get a little taste of Germany. Rochtoberfest is our local rendition of the fable Oktoberfest-style brew.

breweries.name: Kinney Creek Brewery
breweries.description: Kinney Creek Brewery started out as a love for beer, and a lack of quality brewed, right priced beer.  After making home brew for a small test group,  things got bigger and bigger.  Now we are making several varieties of beer to accommodate the need for great Midwest Brewed beer.  We source as many of our ingredients that we can from our local neighbors to bring you the very freshest and eco-friendly beer on the market.,   Currently we are expanding our facility, increasing our advertising, expanding our exposure to local bars & restaurants, and introducing our product to new customers.  So please watch for us in your neighborhood.

breweries.name: Bauhaus Brew Labs
breweries.description: Bauhaus Brew Labs is a family of musicians, scientists, artists and above all, beer lovers, aiming to reinvigorate the spirit of the family brewery. At Bauhaus, we take a unique look at classic German-inspired beer styles, skewed slightly by a sense of play and adventure. Our flavor-forward, sessionable beers are crafted to surprise and delight without taxing the palate.

breweries.name: Tröegs Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Tröegs Brewing Company was established in 1997 by brothers Chris and John Trogner. Since then, the Central PA natives have been handcrafting world-class beers that blend traditional brewing techniques with the innovation and eclecticism of the American craft brewing movement. Today, the Hershey, PA-based brewery produces six year-round beers (Hopback Amber Ale, Troegenator Double Bock, JavaHead Stout, Tröegs Pale Ale, DreamWeaver Wheat, and Perpetual IPA); four seasonal releases as part of the Hop Cycle series (Cultivator Helles Bock, Sunshine Pils, Hop Knife Harvest Ale, and Blizzard of Hops Winter IPA); and two limited beers (Nugget Nectar and Mad Elf Ale). 

In addition to these beers, Tröegs produces a variety of experimental, small batch beers as part of its Scratch Beer Series. These beers are available exclusively at the brewery and most are draft-only limited releases, although some popular Scratch Beers (Fresh Hop Ale, Fest Lager, etc.) are bottled for release through the General Store at the brewery. 

In late 2013, Tröegs introduced a special line of cork & cage bottle releases. The first, LaGrave, is available year-round. Master of Pumpkins was also released in 2013 and will continue with availability in the fall. Other beers such as Jovial have since followed suit. The addition of a canning line not only offers the brewery more flexibility in the way it presents its beers, but also allows Tröegs to provide customers with more packaging options. To date, Tröegs has released Perpetual IPA and Sunshine Pils in 12-ounce cans and Troegenator in 16-ounce cans. Plans to release other seasonal and limited beers in cans are currently in the works. 

The Splinter Series is an extremely limited line of barrel-aged beers packaged in cork & cage bottles. While only a handful of these beers have been produced, Tröegs plans to expand this series with the inclusion of Nebulous (barrel-aged LaGrave with Brett), bourbon barrel-aged Troegenator, and others. 

Tröegs currently distributes its beers throughout Delaware, Massachusetts, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington D.C. In addition, Tröegs plans to expand into other New England markets in 2015.

Our state-of-the-art facility gives visitors a glimpse into the workings of a full production brewery by offering both guided tasting and self-guided tours. Our Tasting Room provides ample seating with views of the brewhouse, where you can sit back and enjoy one of our six year-round beers as well as a variety of seasonal and small-batch experimental brews. 

Our Snack Bar reflects our constant desire to explore, discover and share by focusing on fresh, simple fare that is locally sourced and house-made. With that in mind, we feature a seasonally rotating menu with daily chef’s specials.

www.troegs.com

data.name: Sieban Larger
data.description: A full bodied, malt-accentuated amber lager, best described as Biergarten Marzen. Double decocted from German Pilsner, Vienna and Munich malts with several kettle additions of Nobel hops. We have re-worked this family favorite many times over the years and of the 20 or so recipes created it was "number seven or Sieben” in German that was selected by our diverse tasting panel as the best of the best.

breweries.name: Bay State Brewing
breweries.description: Three guys with over 70 years of brewing knowledge getting together to make Beer better. Chip, Conor and Shawn are gearing up to start full production of Bay State Beer Co. We currently are brewing small runs in a Massachusetts basement brewery in Sturleicesterville, MA and plan to have product available in keg and 6 pk this coming April. We will keep you updated as we go! Great Beer should be interesting, inviting and refreshing - both distinctive and drinkable. Our mission is to make Great Beer!

data.name: Slanted Rock Oktoberfest
data.description: A medium light bodied traditional marzen style lager. Heavy use of Munich malt creates the flavor profile, and a touch of Vienna adds some toasted flavor.

breweries.name: Slanted Rock Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Slanted Rock Brewing Company, LLC was founded in Meridian, Idaho on June 2011 by Bob Lonseth and Vincent Melchor. The Partners and additional investment from John E. MacCrisken has financed the start-up of this venture.

Slanted Rock plans to start Operations in Fall 2012 with a 15 BBL Brewhouse, 2-15BBL Fermenters, 1- 30BBL Fermenter, 1-15BBL Brite Tank and 1-30BBL Brite Tank. Production volume will be packaged in kegs initially with hopes of adding bottle or canning in the future.

Keg Sales will be self-distributed initially, with future distribution outside of Idaho. Retail Customers can buy kegs and pick-up direct from the location at a discounted keg price. Individuals can also purchase kegs in the following sizes: ½ BBL, 1/6 BBL

The brewery location will open a tap room where Slanted Rock and other selected craft brewers will be on tap. Sample flights, pints, half pints & growlers will be available for sale.

data.name: Smoked Frau Blücher! Oktoberfest
data.description: Did somebody say “Frau Blücher?” (Neighhh!) Enthusiastic movie buff and FSB brewmeister, Herr Darren Link, is giddy to introduce this Young Frankenstein-inspired first-ever FSB small-batch beer! So go ahead and say it…you know you want to! “Smoked Frau Blücher!” (Neighhh!) A traditionally brewed Oktoberfestbier and then, after tireless experimentation, this beer is given new life with a Fifth Street Brewpub-twist of oak smoked wheat. Yeah, we know what you’re thinkin’, Technically this is not a true Märzenbier. However, be assured that the dark copper color promises all the full-bodied, rich, toasty flavors of fall you would expect. With “Smoked Frau Blücher!” (Neighhh!), you get the added bonus of the perfectly balanced taste of oak with a mild hop profile that drinks very easy. Prost meine Damen, Herren…und Pferde! (Translation: Cheers ladies, men and horses …)

data.name: Smoked Marzen
data.description: When the weather is right, there’s nothing like an Oktoberfest/Märzenbier and all its malty glory. But why make yet another Märzen that gets lost in the shuffle? We decided to include some smoked malt, actually a part of some traditional Märzen recipes, to set ours apart. There’s still a rich, sticky-sweet malt chararcter, and a deep ruby color, but the smoked edge adds a fun turn to the flavor profile and also dries out the mouthfeel a bit.

data.name: Squashtoberfest
data.description: An Oktoberfest style lager beer utilizing a Bavarian Lager yeast strain, German Munich malts, and 150 lbs of Australian Butter Squash.  The beer has a beautiful orange-amber fall color with a nice malt body and low bitterness.  The squash imparts a slight nose and pleasant after-taste.

In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Blue Ridge Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Blue Ridge Brewing Co. is an established restaurant and brewery, offering 15 years of experience brewing only the finest of home brews and cooking an extraordinary array of unique dishes. Please, stop on by!

Born in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Greenville's Brew-Pub continues to pay homage to one simple creed, to provide our customers the very best we can! We're as proud of Chef Rich's House-Made Menu as we are of Jay's Freshly Crafted Brews!

breweries.name: People's Brewing Company
breweries.description: The People's Brewing Company provides high quality hand-crafted beer and education of the craft beer industry to the people of Lafayette and the state of Indiana while providing community leadership with environmentally friendly business practices. We offer a taproom and tours of our facility. Our staff is fully trained on the brewing process, beer styles, and beer production. We encourage our customers to become educated in craft beers and local beer history.

data.name: Stitches: Gerry Cheevers
data.description: Hallertau hops give this full-bodied Oktoberfest Lager its spicy yet tempered aroma. It pours a gorgeous dark amber, reddish colour (reminiscent of the flesh of black plums), topped off with a nice ivory-coloured foam. The aromatics are of dark fruit at the front (plums and dark cherries) with hints of hazelnut and almonds shining through. A touch of port accented with nutmeg round out the nose. The body is warm and inviting with caramel, toffee, hints of chocolate, and baked plums. The finish is slightly dry and very smooth. A formidable match for any occasion.

breweries.name: Lake of Bays Brewing Company
breweries.description: The Lake of Bays Brewing Company is Northern Ontario's newest craft brewery. We busted our butts for more than a year getting ready to launch, and now our retail store and brewery in Baysville is open for business (woohoo!). Try our beer and see what Pure Northern Taste is all about. Cheers!

data.name: Stratomarzen Festbier
data.description: Anyone who takes the leap 24 miles above Earth is our kind of guy. Felix, this one's for you. Our Festbier is a well-balanced creamy Bavarian lager, chestnut in color with an intense caramel nose, medium body, and a crisp clean finish. So put on your lederhosen, grab a Stratomarzen, and dance to the Fall here on Earth.

breweries.name: Sky High Brewing & Pub
breweries.description:
You've noticed the sky reaching beams coming out of the old Avalon Cinema building... You noticed that the street was blocked all day as we installed our brew tanks... You've noticed Sky High Brewing & Pub!

The Tasting Room is officially open on the mezzanine level; we will open the whole space in sections as each new level is ready. We plan to install as many bike racks as we can... and encourage two-wheeled transportation. :)

data.name: Sunktoberfest Lager
data.description: Sunktoberfest Lager is a German style Oktoberfest lager brewed in celebration of the fall season. Its deep orange hues reflect the colors of the changing autumn landscape and the higher alcohol warms the body against the cooler evenings.

data.name: Teufel Hunden
data.description:
Legend has it that in WWI, the fortitude and ferocity shown by Marines earned them a fearsome nickname by their German counterparts: Teufel Hunden, or “Devil Dogs.” That savage sobriquet has stuck around to inspire new generations of soldiers towards honor and tenacity.

This fall, Service Brewing Co. introduces its own devilish brew. Teufel Hunden is a traditional Oktoberfest-style Marzen lager, unfiltered with a deep copper hue, a toasted malt aroma and a clean, dry finish.

breweries.name: Service Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We are a veteran owned and operated craft brewery, in Savannah Georgia, dedicated to honoring those that have put their lives at risk and their country and community first.

We will donate a portion of our revenues to assist charities that support service. 

Our dedication to this cause is unique and our approach to craft beer is equally unique.

While brewing our year round beers on a large scale we maintain a small batch Research and Development division to enable experimentation and innovation using locally available ingredients to connect our farmers and consumers with our beer and our mission.

breweries.name: Track 7 Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Graham and Scott families established Track 7 Brewing Company as an outlet for creative expression through unique and artisanal beers. The name, Track 7 Brewing Company, was selected in part due to the brewery’s proximity to the old Western Pacific railroad tracks, west of Curtis Park, and as a nod to the integral role the railroad has and continues to play in Sacramento’s rich history.

Track 7's approach to beer is in the vein of the firmly-hopped West Coast tradition, but without fidelity to a singular “style”. This unfocused approach allows Track 7 to experiment with all varieties of beer, regardless of American, Belgian, English, or German inspiration.

data.name: Ümlaut Böktoberfest
data.description:
The first offering in the Woodsman Series, Ümlaut Böktoberfest is a dark, luscious Bavarian-style lager beer that spent six weeks lagering in oak barrels at 35 degrees fahrenheit. It is a twisted version of the classic German Märzen/Oktoberfest beer popular throughout the autumn season. The Strangeways treatment is a strong lager that boasts a malty, earthy sweetness and includes a subtle touch of smoked malts. German Opal and Smaragd hops round out the balance and lend just the right touch of herbal and floral notes to the flavor and aroma.

The oak barrels utilized initially housed Rebel Yell bourbon, and then more recently held a Trump Winery product called Cru, which is a unique fortified white port-style wine with an 18% abv. These two previous barrel inhabitants set the stage for this beer to dazzle and shine during its debut performance. As well as add a dynamic complexity balanced with subtle nuances to make you want to celebrate Oktoberfest every day with a Maß of Ümlaut Böktoberfest. O'zapft is! Prost!

The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). breweries.name: Strangeways Brewing
breweries.description: Strangeways Brewing is a one-of-a-kind, 8,400 square-foot production brewery that is open to the public daily.  It houses multiple tasting room spaces along with outdoor seating, and always has 25+ unique beers on tap.  RateBeer named Strangeways “Best Brewery Tap Room in Virginia” in 2014/2015.  Outfitted with a 20 barrel brewhouse, this is where we unhinge the status quo, break through the boring, and invite the unknown.  Make Strangeways Brewing one of your adventure destinations for regular tastings, tours, event/private party bookings, and whatever strange events we come up with.

breweries.name: Woodward Avenue Brewers
breweries.description: Woodward Avenue Brewers, or “WAB”, as we're affectionately called, is much more than a restaurant or bar. Established in 1997, The WAB has become a landmark along Woodward Avenue in Ferndale and has welcomed visitors – those in the neighborhood and those far and wide – for more than 16 years. Pioneers of the craft brew scene, WAB is the go-to gathering place for patrons to enjoy handcrafted brews, great food, friendly atmosphere and the action on historic Woodward Avenue.

breweries.name: West O Beer
breweries.description: Our passion is making high quality craft beer, so we built a state of the art brewery in West Okoboji, Iowa. We have access to some of the best water in the world, and it's a quality you can taste.

data.name: Zeltbier
data.description: Gloriously golden for crisp fall days, this satisfying lager features the lightly toasted flavor of quality German malts balanced with the perfect touch of herbal, German hops.
data.foodPairings: Soft pretzels, roasted chicken and salads

breweries.name: Victory Brewing Company
breweries.description: Having trained in Germany, we appreciate the artistic freedom we have here in the US. Here creativity is embraced by a fervent core of consumers and we are happy to serve that audience with our experience in traditional methods, selection of choice, often imported ingredients, and the best processing that technology can offer us. We relish the opportunity to please both ourselves and our audience with our flavorful creations.  We've invested more than our lives in this. Take a look at Victory Brewing Company's Beers.

breweries.description: Since opening our doors in 2001, our goal has been to create traditional European style beers while maintaining the unique flavor that is Asheville. Our tasty creations can be found all over North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, and Tennessee, with new territories coming soon.

data.name: Zirkusfest
data.description: This traditional Marzen boasts all the flavors one wants in a rich Oktoberfest lager without all the heavy finish. The use of Munich malt provides upfront biscuity and honey flavors that fade into a dry finish.

breweries.name: Hi-Wire Brewing
breweries.description:
At Hi-Wire, we really want to embrace our craft and be as independent and authentic as possible, while also managing to maintain an approachability to our product, as we feature highly drinkable, hand-crafted brews.

We’re fortunate to be able to be a part of one of the Craft Capitals of the country. Located in Asheville's "Brewery District", Hi-Wire's brewery and tasting room are within walking distance of six other local breweries in a few block radius. Come visit us in June, 2013.

breweries.name: Dillon Dam Brewery
breweries.description:
The Dillon Dam Brewery is the Largest Brewpub in the Colorado Rockies and one of the largest Brew-Pubs in the nation as well as one of the best family restaurants in Summit County, Colorado.

We serve signature, seasonal, session and big beers -- primarily ales and lagers -- and we brew over 1,700 barrels per year. WE have a 13-tap system. This makes us the 37th largest Brew-Pub in the nation (out of nearly 1,000). That's a lot of Dam Beer™.

We are an American-style restaurant serving lunch, dinner, and a kids menu. Our extensive menu has over 70 items to choose from. We serve the families of and visitors to Dillon, Silverthorne, Frisco, Keystone, Breckenridge and Copper Mountain.

We are also an easy stop-off for those traveling west to Vail, Steamboat Springs and Aspen or east to Denver. In fact we are a great stop for anyone traveling I-70.
